screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .cfm file in Adobe ColdFusion Builder 2018
screenshot.caption: CFM file open in Adobe ColdFusion Builder 2018

description: You will most likely encounter CFM files only if you are a web developer and integrating ColdFusion functionality into your webpages. Developers typically use Adobe ColdFusion Builder for creating applications in CFML. However, they may use a variety of other CFML IDEs and editors, such as Adobe Dreamweaver, CFEclipse (plug-in for Eclipse), and CFBrackets (extension for the Brackets source code editor).
CFML is a tag-based language that features a syntax similar to HTML and XML . It includes unique tags and support for custom tags for creating dynamic web applications. All CFML tags begin with cf .
NOTE: ColdFusion was originally developed by Allaire, then later bought by Macromedia, and is now distributed by Adobe Systems after acquiring Macromedia in 2005.
